item.title: Pot hole in road, 15th October
item.description:
It’s a dead end road but busy and not always possible to avoid it. The road in general is not good as dug up and patches done by so many contractors.

item.title: Cycle lane blocked with twigs and leaves, 15th October

Cycle lane is covered in twigs and leaves making it slippery and unsafe

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 15th October
item.description:
Trees Overhanging/overgrown limb Tree is very close to 8 Huxley Way and taller than the house. Proximity of tree and its height & width blocks light to 8 Huxley Way and overgrows the boundary fence. Strong likelihood tree roots are risk to the boundary fence and the house. I hope you can trim back rather than remove the tree.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 15th October
item.description:
Blocked or damaged drain Drainage problem or no drainage at all. Can’t see as it is flooded. Water level has stayed same/increased in last 24 hrs
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sustained damage problem, 14th October
item.description:
Non-Illuminated bollards and signs BollardSustained other damage Bollard Bollard which is part of a build-out was knocked over on 13/10/23. Somebody has stood it up again but it is not screwed in to the ground any longer so could easily fall over again. This would be dangerous as road users would be unable to see the build-out.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole, 14th October
item.description:
Thus pothole did have a white circle around it but it is fading very quickly and the pothole is now very deep- deeper than a golf ball. I knew it was around there but with rain I couldn’t see it and have damaged my tyre. This needs fixing urgently .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 162, Old Bath Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 14th October
item.description:
